title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: The sleep-debt-tracker is a project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to help users visualize and manage their sleep debt. This application provides a user-friendly interface to track sleep patterns, calculate sleep debt, and offers insights for improving sleep habits. Leveraging TypeScript for robust development and organization, this project serves as a practical example of web application development focusing on personal well-being.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a project template built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and MUI, providing a solid foundation for new web applications. It leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and management, showcasing best practices for project structure and common patterns within the React ecosystem. This repository serves as a starter kit and example implementation for building modern, type-safe web applications.

title: next-voting
description: next-voting is a project implementing a modern voting application built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. It provides a robust and user-friendly platform for creating and participating in online votes and surveys. This repository showcases best practices for developing interactive web applications and demonstrates the effective use of these technologies for a real-world problem.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project demonstrating interactive map visualizations built using HTML and Python. This repository explores various techniques for displaying geographical data and creating engaging map-based applications, falling under the broader topic of data visualization projects.

title: jovian
description: The `jovian` repository is a Python-based CRUD application built using Flask, PostgreSQL, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting. This project showcases how to implement Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations within a web application framework, leveraging Python for backend logic, PostgreSQL for data storage, and web technologies for the user interface. It serves as a practical example and learning resource for building similar applications with these technologies.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository provides a web-based interface for visualizing and interacting with Robofleet robotics data. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, this project offers a dynamic dashboard for monitoring robot status, sensor data, and task progress within a Robofleet environment. It aims to streamline robot management and facilitate data-driven decision-making for robotics projects.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, demonstrating a modern dashboard implementation using Next.js. This repository serves as a practical example showcasing best practices for building responsive and interactive user interfaces with a focus on project management and data visualization.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, it provides a user-friendly interface to filter, search, and explore ROS log data, aiding in debugging and performance analysis for robotics projects. This project focuses on improving the efficiency and clarity of ROS log interpretation.

title: resume

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built using Jupyter Notebook and Python, contains a collection of personal finance projects and tutorials. It explores various financial concepts and tools through practical application, covering topics like budgeting, investment analysis, and financial modeling, all implemented with Python. It aims to provide a hands-on learning experience for anyone interested in applying Python to manage and understand their finances.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript, CSS, and HTML project designed to create a visually appealing and interactive event calendar. It allows users to easily manage and display events dynamically, providing a flexible and customizable solution for scheduling and organization. This project focuses on providing a clean and efficient implementation of a dynamic event calendar using web technologies.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and styled with Tailwind CSS, designed for real-time tracking of IoT assets.  Leveraging Supabase for backend services and data storage, this project showcases a modern approach to asset management through a user-friendly interface, focusing on efficient data handling and responsive design.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project management tool built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to help users brainstorm, organize, and prioritize their ideas. The repository provides a clean and intuitive interface for managing projects, capturing inspiration, and tracking progress, making it an ideal platform for both individual and collaborative brainstorming sessions. The project utilizes modern web technologies to offer a responsive and user-friendly experience.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-seller is an e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router) and TypeScript, showcasing a modern approach to online fruit sales. Leveraging technologies like MUI for the user interface and React Query for efficient data fetching, this repository serves as a practical example of a typed, full-stack web application covering key topics in modern web development.
